alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:04PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Laurel, northeastern Pulaski, Jackson and Rockcastle Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 304 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bee Lick, or 8 miles west of Mount Vernon, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Level Green around 310 PM EDT. Maretburg, Spiro, Wabp and Bromo around 315 PM EDT. Lake Linville, Sand Springs, Hiatt and Hansford around 320 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mount Vernon, Burr, Muellersville, Renfro Valley, Wellhope, Wildie, Roundstone, Flat Rock, Orlando, Dudley Station, Pine Hill, Hummel, Sand Hill, Donaro, Withers, Sinks, Bummer, Climax, Jep Hill, Robinet, Cooksburg, Gauley, Johnetta, Goochland, Camp Wildcat, Threelinks, Hazel Patch, Dango, Horse Lick, Ardery, Carico, Cruise, Middlefork, Loam, Templer, Lamero and Eberle. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 49 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
